cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 105 miles ESE of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across Hispaniola toward the central and north-western Bahamas, then recurving north-northwest and paralleling the U.S. Southeast coast toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina / southeastern North Carolina coast (around Cape Fear-Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No tropical cyclone watches yet issued for the U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: No tropical cyclone warnings yet issued for the U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through the Carolinas is in the projected impact swath
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are possible with a 15 % cumulative chance; peak probabilities arrive in 4–5 days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 2–4 ft of surge is possible along the southeast North Carolina coast, including the Cape Fear River mouth.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Isaias could produce 4–6 inches of rainfall along the coastal plain, including Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf preceding the storm’s arrival.
